properties.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued January 8 at 2:59PM CST until January 11 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Paducah KY
properties.description:
...Flash Flooding Possible Friday Night Into Saturday...

.A storm system will move northeast across southeast Missouri and
southern Illinois Friday night, bringing widespread heavy
rainfall.

The National Weather Service in Paducah has issued a

* Flash Flood Watch for portions of southern Illinois and
southeast Missouri, including the following counties, in
southern Illinois, Edwards, Franklin, Hamilton, Jackson,
Jefferson, Perry, Union, Wabash, Wayne, and Williamson. In
southeast Missouri, Bollinger, Butler, Cape Girardeau, Carter,
Perry, Ripley, and Wayne.

* From Friday evening through Saturday morning

* A period of heavy rain is expected Friday night into Saturday
morning. Rainfall amounts from 1 to 3 inches are likely within a
six hour period. Storm total rainfall by the end of the day
Saturday will range from 3 to 5 inches.

* Rapid rises in creeks and streams are expected. Low water
crossings may become impassable. Some normally dry ground
outside of flood prone areas may experience flooding.
properties.instruction:
A Flash Flood Watch means that conditions may develop that lead
to flash flooding. Flash flooding is a very dangerous situation.

You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action
should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

NWSheadline: FLASH FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING
